references.paper_title: Limits of private learning with access to public data
references.reason: This paper establishes foundational results on the limitations of private learning when public data is available, which is directly relevant to the concept of semi-private learning explored in the target paper.

references.paper_title: Private query release assisted by public data
references.reason: This paper introduces the concept of private query release assisted by public data, a technique highly relevant to the study of credit attribution by machine learning algorithms.

references.paper_title: Private learning and sanitization: Pure vs. approximate differential privacy
references.reason: This paper provides insights into the fundamental trade-offs between privacy and accuracy in machine learning, contributing to the theoretical understanding of differentially private learning and its extensions relevant to credit attribution.

references.paper_title: Private distribution learning with public data: The view from sample compression
references.reason: This recent work directly addresses the interplay between private learning, public data, and sample compression, offering a perspective closely aligned with the core ideas of the target paper.
This paper provides further advancements in the area of private learning with public data, enhancing the theoretical understanding of techniques relevant to the challenges of credit attribution.
